alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 5:31PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dale and southeastern Coffee Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Enterprise, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Elba, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Level Plains, New Brockton, Richburg, Lucile, Gerald, Lowe Army Heliport, Turner Crossroads, Central City, Camp Humming Hills, Cool Springs, Clintonville, Battens Crossroads, Shell Army Field, Goodman, Camp Alaflo Bsa and Keyton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
